intro: Sida microphylla, commonly known as small-leaved sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States and parts of Mexico, often found in sandy or disturbed soils. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Sida microphylla is often considered a weed but has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
